title: Floating exchange rates follow market forces

content.question: Which of the following is true if exchange rates are freely floating?

choices.label: The free market forces of demand and supply determine the equilibrium exchange rates.
The demand curve for the currency is upward sloping.
Only nominal values of currency can be determined.
The market determines the equilibrium value of the currency, but governments buy and sell currency at a fixed rate.
Governments are unable to affect the international value of their currency.

content.answer: The free market forces of demand and supply determine the equilibrium exchange rates.
